sentences: Wesley Louden Borland (born February 7, 1975) is an American rock musician.
He gained popularity when Limp Bizkit achieved mainstream success in the late 1990s and early 2000s.
He gained popularity when Limp Bizkit achieved mainstream success in the late 1990s and early 2000s.
He formed Big Dumb Face with his brother Scott in 1998 and left Limp Bizkit in 2001 to start side projects including Eat the Day and The Damning

He formed Big Dumb Face with his brother Scott in 1998 and left Limp Bizkit in 2001 to start side projects including Eat the Day and The Damning
After rejoining Limp Bizkit in 2004, Borland founded Black Light Burns, with whom he has released three studio albums and a covers album.
Limp Bizkit went on hiatus following the release of their album The Unquestionable Truth (Part 1) (2005).
However, the band's original lineup reunited in 2009 and recorded their fifth studio album, Gold Cobra (2011).

In 2016, Borland released his solo album Crystal Machete.

sentences: In April 1998, Wes married his long-time girlfriend Heather McMillan.
The couple divorced in 2001.
His second marriage was to Anna Carlise in March 2009.
They divorced in 2013.
In October 2016, he married Carré Callaway, lead singer of Queen Kwong.
Callaway filed for divorce in 2019.
Borland used Ibanez seven-string guitars exclusively from 1997 until 1999.
Borland used Ibanez seven-string guitars exclusively from 1997 until 1999.
He is currently one of two American owners of one.
This was eventually replaced by a custom-made Master Guitars "Cremona" 4-string, which he uses to this day.
A Facebook photo posted by Fred Durst in 2012 shows Borland playing the Cremona again  for studio purposes.
In 2005, Yamaha approached Borland about a new signature guitar, which was almost 100% designed by Borland.
The model CV820WB was released that same year.
He does not currently have a signature model with Jackson.

Other guitars Borland has been seen with before are a 1976 Fender Starcaster a stock ESP LTD V-401DX (used on the Limp Bizkit reunion tour for playing songs on Results May Vary) and Mayones Regius Pro 6, Legend and Setius GTM 6 Baritone guitars.

Other guitars Borland has been seen with before are a 1976 Fender Starcaster a stock ESP LTD V-401DX (used on the Limp Bizkit reunion tour for playing songs on Results May Vary) and Mayones Regius Pro 6, Legend and Setius GTM 6 Baritone guitars.

During the late 1990s when Borland played 7-string guitars, he played them like one would play a 6-string guitar by tuning the highest string to C# as well, while maintaining standard C# tuning all the way to the seventh string.

This technique was later used by Stephen Carpenter of Deftones so he could play the songs he originally recorded on a six-string without losing the feel of a seven-string, as Limp Bizkit and the Deftones had toured together in the mid 1990s.
In 2000, Borland would use the Mesa Boogie heads in conjunction with a Diezel VH4.
In the mid 2000s, on the recording of Cruel Melody and The Unquestionable Truth (Part 1), Borland's main amp was the Diezel VH4.

Starting with the 2008 recording of The Moment You Realize You're Going to Fall Borland played mainly Orange Amps (specifically the Thunderverb 100 models) since touring in support of Cruel Melody began and has continued to use them since then, also on Gold Cobra.
